question.para: What are the basic packages to run ADA in Windows?

answer.para: ADA needs at least three packages to run in windows:

listitem.para: Ant: A Java based build tool. ADA relies on ANT to decide which documents to build and which tools to use for the task.
Cygwin: A linux-like environment for Windows.

answer.para: The first step then is to make sure you have a Java Run-Time Environment (JRE) properly installed.
The second step is to download the cygwin installer a program to select the packages wto install. Once started, the initial page is shown in the following figure.

After starting the set-up program, you need to specify several parameters to stablish a connection with a server. Keep advancing on the installation steps until the screen to select the packages like the one in the following figure is shown.

Click in the botton with name View that appears above the package list until the word Full appears to its left. At that point, all packages suitable to be installed are shown alphabetically ordered. From the list, you need to select at least the following packages.

listitem.para: docbook-xml43 (or more recent): Docbook XML DTD
docbook-xsl: XSL stylesheets for the DocBook XML DTD
git: Fast version control system used to download the latest ADA version.

answer.para: ADA is capable of using additional tools, but they are not essential for the installation. The set-up program takes a few minutes to download (through a net connection) all the required packages. This step will take a few minutes and will depend significantly on the speed of that connection.

After all the required packages are installed, finish the execution of the set-up program and start a Cygwin shell. This is usually done by clicking on the icon that the set-up program has left on your desktop or browsing through the program menu and selecting the Cygwin executable. Once starte, a window like the one shown in the following figure appears on the screen.

The windows is a typical linux command interpreter that is ready to received your orders. The first check that needs to be performed is to make sure the Java Run-time Environment is properly installed. By simply typing the command which java, if the answer is a single path to a file with name java, the JRE is properly installed. If the message states that no java could be found, you need to review your Java installation.

The third step is to install Ant. Ant is Java based, and therefore, installing the application simply amounts to deploying a directory and make sure that a couple of environment variables point to the right locations.

Once Cygwin has been installed, you have two choices: install Ant as a regular windows application, or install Ant within Cygwin. The two choices are very similar from the point of view of the installation process, just unpack the zip archive in one location. The important step is to set the environment variables ANT_HOME to point to the new directory and PATH to include the bin directory within Ant.

Once you installed Ant, you may check the installation again with the command which ant. As in the case of Java, if an absolute path is shown, Ant is ready to execute. If not, you need to review your installation procecure.
